svg.text: This hierarchical model demonstrates a traffic light system with DE (Discrete Event) and ERG (Event Relationship Graph). The DE model simulates an execution environment, which randomly triggers errors. The traffic light switches into error mode on receiving an error event (generated by the PoissonClock), and the yellow light flashes. After 10 units of model time, the traffic light recovers and resumes its function.
(Refer to another TrafficLight model in the SR domain)
Look inside ERGModalModel to see the design of the traffic light controller modeled by a hierarchical ERG modal model.

ports. If an Error input is received, the most imminent schedule of any event in Normal is cancelled, and the Error event (also hierarchical) happens. If an OK input is received, the Normal event is rescheduled. This means the initial event in it is fired again.

The Init event is scheduled at 0.0 in global modal time. It schedules Normal to happen in the next firing (which further schedule more events in it). The Init event also registers React, which handles inputs from the input

This level models the normal function of the traffic light system. The car light controls the pedestrian light. Outputs are sent via the output ports, which control each individual light. The inputs are simply ignored.
The yellow light is turned on and off, while all other lights remain off. The TurnYellowLight event has a parameter named "param" with type int, which takes value 0 or 1.
